description: The employee_full_name determines the corporate_username. In this dataset, the same employee full name must always map to the same corporate username.
The corporate_username determines the email_address. The same corporate username must always map to the same email address.
The email_address determines the employee_full_name. The same email address must always map to the same employee full name.
The email_address determines the device_hostname. The same email address must always be associated with the same device hostname.
The device_hostname determines the device_serial_number. The same device hostname must always map to the same device serial number.
The device_serial_number determines the email_address. The same device serial number must always be associated with the same email address.
The combination of employee_full_name and device_hostname determines the access_badge_code. The same employee on the same device hostname must always map to the same access badge code.
The access_badge_code determines the employee_full_name. The same access badge code must always map to the same employee full name.
The combination of corporate_username and device_serial_number determines the device_hostname. The same username using the same serial number must always map to the same device hostname.
The access_badge_code determines the corporate_username. The same access badge code must always map to the same corporate username.
The employee_full_name must not be unique. This forces the generator to simulate a log/audit scenario where the same person appears multiple times.
The access_badge_code must not be unique. This ensures that the badge assignment remains consistent across multiple occurrences of the same employee.
